What are the steps to bootstrap Verus and Komodo on both Linux and Windows, and what considerations should be taken when launching the Verus wallet for the first time?

To bootstrap Verus and Komodo on both Linux and Windows, you'll need to follow these steps:

**Step 1-3: Bootstrap Verus**
To bootstrap Verus, you'll need to download the VRSC bootstrap file and unpack it into the correct directory. On Linux, you can do this by running the command `tar -xvf VRSC-bootstrap.tar.gz -C ~/.komodo/VRSC` in the terminal. On Windows, you can download the file from `https://bootstrap.0x03.services/veruscoin/VRSC-bootstrap.tar.gz` and then unzip it into the `%appdata%\Komodo\VRSC` folder. Make sure to delete the contents of the folder first, but be sure to back up your `wallet.dat` file.

**Step 4 (Optional): Bootstrap Komodo**
If you want to use Komodo alongside Verus, or if you want to have KMD native support within the Verus wallet, you'll need to sync the entire Komodo blockchain. To do this, you can download the latest KMD bootstrap file and unpack it into the correct directory. On Linux, you can do this by running the command `wget https://bootstrap.0x03.services/komodo/KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz` followed by `tar -xvf KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz -C ~/.komodo`. On Windows, you can download the file from `https://bootstrap.0x03.services/komodo/KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz` and then unzip it into the `%appdata%\Komodo` folder.

**Step 5: Launch Verus Wallet**
When launching the Verus wallet for the first time, you'll need to choose VRSC under the "Native Mode" dropdown. You'll then be prompted to download the latest Zcash Params, which you should follow the steps to do so. Note that new `wallet.dat` files will be generated in the `.komodo/VRSC` folder during the first launch of the updated Verus wallet while it syncs up. If you're updating from a previous version, you'll need to overwrite these files with your backed-up `wallet.dat` file later.

In general, bootstrapping Verus and Komodo involves downloading and unpacking the necessary files into the correct directories, and then launching the Verus wallet for the first time and following the prompts to download the latest Zcash Params.

:
tar -xvf VRSC-bootstrap.tar.gz -C .komodo/VRSC
Windows:
Open your browser and paste the following URL
https://bootstrap.0x03.services/veruscoin/VRSC-bootstrap.tar.gz
You may need 7-Zip to unzip this file.
Delete the contents of your %appdata%\Komodo\VRSC folder, ensuring your wallet.dat file was backed up in Step 1.
When the file completes downloading, unzip the contents into the following folder: %appdata%\Komodo\VRSC
Note:
New wallet.dat files will be generated in these folders during the first launch of the updated Verus wallet while it syncs up, you’ll overwrite these files later with your backed-up wallet if you are updating.
STEP 4 (Optional) — Get Recent KMD Bootstrap
If you are installing Verus alongside a version of Komodo’s Agama wallet, or you would like support for KMD native within Verus wallet, you’ll need to sync the entire Komodo blockchain again due to the new Zcash Params which come with this latest version of Verus. Since the KMD blockchain is so large, it’s recommended to download a recent bootstrap to save time syncing.
Linux:
From the terminal, navigate to your home folder with cd ~ and download the latest KMD bootstrap by issuing the following command:
wget https://bootstrap.0x03.services/komodo/KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz
After the download completes, unpack the file into your .komodo folder with the following command:
tar -xvf KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz -C .komodo
Windows:
Open your browser and paste the following URL
https://bootstrap.0x03.services/komodo/KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz
You may need 7-Zip to unzip this file.
When the file completes downloading, unzip the contents into the following folder: %appdata%\Komodo
STEP 5 — First, Launch Verus Wallet
On first launch of the newly updated Verus wallet choose VRSC under the “Native Mode” drop down.
You’ll receive a modal prompt to download the latest Zcash Params, follow the steps to do so.
